description: Retrieves the information about the volume.

parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the kdb environment, whose clusters can attach to the volume.

parameters.name: volumeName
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the volume.

nested_items.name: environmentId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the kdb environment, whose clusters can attach to the volume.

nested_items.name: volumeName
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the volume.

nested_items.name: volumeType
nested_items.description: The type of file system volume. Currently, FinSpace only supports NAS_1 volume type.

nested_items.name: volumeArn
nested_items.description: The ARN identifier of the volume.

nested_items.name: nas1Configuration
nested_items.description: Specifies the configuration for the Network attached storage (NAS_1) file system volume.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the network attached storage.

nested_items.name: size
nested_items.description: The size of the network attached storage. For storage type SSD_1000 and SSD_250 you can select the minimum size as 1200 GB or increments of 2400 GB. For storage type HDD_12 you can select the minimum size as 6000 GB or increments of 6000 GB.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of volume creation.
CREATING --- The volume creation is in progress.
CREATE_FAILED --- The volume creation has failed.
ACTIVE --- The volume is active.
UPDATING --- The volume is in the process of being updated.
UPDATE_FAILED --- The update action failed.
UPDATED --- The volume is successfully updated.
DELETING --- The volume is in the process of being deleted.
DELETE_FAILED --- The system failed to delete the volume.
DELETED --- The volume is successfully deleted.

nested_items.name: statusReason
nested_items.description: The error message when a failed state occurs.

nested_items.name: createdTimestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp at which the volume was created in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A description of the volume.

nested_items.name: azMode
nested_items.description: The number of availability zones you want to assign per volume. Currently, FinSpace only supports SINGLE for volumes. This places dataview in a single AZ.

nested_items.name: availabilityZoneIds
nested_items.description: The identifier of the availability zones.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: lastModifiedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The last time that the volume was updated in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

nested_items.name: attachedClusters
nested_items.description: A list of cluster identifiers that a volume is attached to.

nested_items.name: clusterName
nested_items.description: A unique name for the attached cluster.

nested_items.name: clusterType
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of cluster. The volume for TP and RDB cluster types will be used for TP logs.

nested_items.name: clusterStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the attached cluster.
PENDING --- The cluster is pending creation.
CREATING --- The cluster creation process is in progress.
CREATE_FAILED --- The cluster creation process has failed.
RUNNING --- The cluster creation process is running.
UPDATING --- The cluster is in the process of being updated.
DELETING --- The cluster is in the process of being deleted.
DELETED --- The cluster has been deleted.
DELETE_FAILED --- The cluster failed to delete.
